intro: Ophrys transhyrcana subsp. sintenisii, commonly known as the Sintenisi orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Ophrys, which is known for its mimicry of female insects to attract male pollinators. This subspecies is characterized by its unique floral morphology, featuring a specialized lip that resembles a female bee. It typically grows in rocky or semi-arid habitats, often in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
